skill.name: Gemini Research Subagent
skill.description: Delegates large-context code analysis to Gemini CLI. Use when analyzing codebases, tracing bugs across files, reviewing architecture, or performing security audits. Gemini reads, Claude implements.
skill.summary: Delegates large-context code analysis to Gemini CLI. Use when analyzing codebases, tracing bugs acro...
skill.author: DasBluEyedDevil

security_audit.summary: This skill is a prompt-based wrapper with no executable code. It provides instructions for delegating large-context analysis to Gemini CLI. The skill itself poses minimal risk.

content.value_statement: Complex codebases are difficult to analyze without full context. This skill delegates large-scale code analysis to Gemini CLI while Claude handles implementation, following a proven research-then-implement workflow.
actual_capabilities: Delegates large-context analysis to Gemini CLI
Provides 10 pre-defined research roles (reviewer, debugger, planner, security, auditor, explainer, migrator, documenter, dependency-mapper, onboarder)
Offers multiple output templates (implement-ready, fix-ready, verify, architecture)
Returns structured output with summary, file references, analysis, and recommendations
Enforces research-first workflow (Gemini researches, Claude implements)
limitations: Requires gemini-cli to be installed and configured separately
The wrapper script must be available at ./skills/gemini.agent.wrapper.sh
Does not perform code execution or file modifications directly
Does not work offline (requires Gemini API access)

use_cases.title: Analyze unfamiliar codebases
use_cases.description: Understand large codebases quickly by delegating research to Gemini before implementing changes

use_cases.title: Perform security audits
use_cases.description: Use the security role to identify vulnerabilities across multiple files with full context awareness

use_cases.title: Plan architecture changes
use_cases.description: Get architectural recommendations before implementation to avoid costly refactoring later

prompt_templates.title: Basic Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the @src/ directory and summarize the main components, their relationships, and key architectural patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the authentication module at @src/auth/ for bugs, security issues, and code quality concerns.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Tracing
prompt_templates.prompt: Trace the root cause of the login failure. Check auth.ts, user.service.ts, and token.handler.ts for issues.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-implementation Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan how to add caching to the data layer. Consider existing patterns, dependencies, and performance impact.

output_examples.input: Analyze @src/ for security vulnerabilities in the authentication flow
output: Summary: Authentication flow has 3 medium-risk issues
Analysis: Token expiration not enforced, SQL injection possible in user lookup, missing rate limiting
Recommendations: Add token expiry check, use parameterized queries, implement rate limiting middleware

best_practices: Always use Gemini for research before making multi-file changes
Use the appropriate role for your task (reviewer for bugs, security for vulnerabilities, planner for features)
Verify implementations with Gemini after completing changes using the verify template
anti_patterns: Using Gemini for simple single-file edits you can handle yourself
Skipping research and directly asking Claude to implement without context
Writing complex multi-part prompts that exceed token limits

faq.question: How do I install the gemini-cli dependency?
faq.answer: Visit https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/cli for installation instructions for your platform.

faq.question: What happens if gemini-cli is not installed?
faq.answer: The wrapper script will fail. Install gemini-cli and configure your API key before using this skill.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code desktop app?
faq.answer: Yes, if Claude Code is configured to load skills from your .claude/skills/ directory.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Yes, code context is sent to Google's Gemini API when using gemini-cli. Review their privacy policy.

faq.question: Why not just use Gemini directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured workflow with roles, templates, and integration with Claude Code for implementation.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Gemini prompting?
faq.answer: It provides a collaborative workflow: Gemini researches with full context, Claude implements, Gemini verifies.
